title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — On a night where the final score felt almost secondary, Michael Jordan authored another indelible chapter in his legend, carrying the Chicago Bulls to a 101-91 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

From the opening tip, this was the Michael Jordan show. He was an unstoppable force, a virtuoso performing at the peak of his powers against a formidable opponent. The Sonics, a team known for their defensive tenacity, had no answer. Jordan sliced through double-teams, hit fall-away jumpers with impossible degrees of difficulty, and attacked the rim with a ferocity that left the United Center in a state of perpetual awe.

When the final horn sounded, the stat sheet told a story of historic proportions: a game-high 45 points. This was not merely a scoring outburst; it was a masterclass in offensive execution under the bright lights of a championship-caliber battle. While Shawn Kemp provided a valiant effort for Seattle with 22 points and Detlef Schrempf added 18, their contributions were ultimately drowned out by the singular force wearing number 23.

The Bulls’ supporting cast played their roles to perfection, feeding the hot hand and providing just enough supplementary scoring. Scottie Pippen’s 11 points and Dennis Rodman’s 16 rebounds were crucial complements to Jordan's tour de force.

But this night belonged to one man. In a season defined by greatness, this 45-point spectacle against a elite defensive team stands as a testament to Jordan's unparalleled ability to rise to any occasion. It was more than a win; it was a reminder of his dominion over the sport, a performance etched not just in the box score, but in the memory of all who witnessed it.
